contents: Provides raw access to the RefinerDB instance created by the RefinerDBProvider
documentation.contentsRaw: Provides raw access to the RefinerDB instance created by the RefinerDBProvider

contents: Provides a stable function to update the the RefinerDB criteria. The setter function follows the same signate as the useState setter function. AKA it takes the previous value and expects you to return the new value.
documentation.contentsRaw:
Provides a stable function to update the the RefinerDB criteria. The setter function
follows the same signate as the useState setter function. AKA it takes the previous
value and expects you to return the new value.

contents: Provides a stable reference to the criteria value as well as a stable update function. Returns a tuple where the first value is the criteria and the second value is the criteria setter (see useSetCriteria if you only need a setter).
documentation.contentsRaw:
Provides a stable reference to the criteria value as well as a stable update function.
Returns a tuple where the first value is the criteria and the second value is the
criteria setter (see useSetCriteria if you only need a setter).

contents: Provides a stable function to update the the RefinerDB criteria's filter. The setter function takes the previous value and expects you to return the new value.
documentation.contentsRaw:
Provides a stable function to update the the RefinerDB criteria's filter. The setter function
takes the previous value and expects you to return the new value.

contents: Provides a stable reference to the criteria's filter value as well as a stable update function. Returns a tuple where the first value is the criteria's filter and the second value is the criteria's filter setter (see useSetFilter if you only need a setter).
documentation.contentsRaw:
Provides a stable reference to the criteria's filter value as well as a stable update function.
Returns a tuple where the first value is the criteria's filter and the second value is the
criteria's filter setter (see useSetFilter if you only need a setter).

contents: Provides the up to date query results. Anytime the indexing state goes back to idle it will check for new query results and update state.
documentation.contentsRaw:
Provides the up to date query results.
Anytime the indexing state goes back to idle
it will check for new query results and update state.

signatures.name: useDebounce
signatures.type: (effectFn: (debouncedValues: any[]) => void | () => void, values: any[], delay: number) => void

signatures.name: useDebouncedEffect
signatures.type: (effectFn: (debouncedValue: T) => void | () => void, value: T, delay: number) => void

contents: Appends the refiner value with an asterisk to perform a "Contains" query

contents: Used internally to avoid having a Web Worker spawn another Web Worker
documentation.contentsRaw:
Used internally to avoid having a Web Worker
spawn another Web Worker

contents: Initialize the db with criteria so you don't have to manually call setCriteria
documentation.contentsRaw:
Initialize the db with criteria so you don't
have to manually call setCriteria

contents: The item property to use as the primary key. Defaults to 'id'
documentation.contentsRaw:
The item property to use as the primary key.
Defaults to 'id'

contents: How long in ms to wait before automatically triggering a reindex. Defaults to 500ms.
documentation.contentsRaw:
How long in ms to wait before automatically triggering
a reindex. Defaults to 500ms.

contents: Initialize the db with indexes so you don't have to manually call setIndexes

contents: Subscribe to changes in the indexing state

contents: The PersistedStore (localStorage, indexedDB, etc...) Defaults to localStorage.

documentation.contentsRaw: Provides the realtime filter value

contents: Defaults to true. If false, only the item Id's will be returned. This can improve performance if you already have your array of items in memory.
documentation.contentsRaw:
Defaults to true. If false, only the item Id's will be returned.
This can improve performance if you already have your array of items in memory.
